headline.main: LENINGRAD IS GIRDED FOR ANY NAZI BLOW; 'Stronger Than Verdun,' City Pledges German Defeat

lead_paragraph: LENINGRAD, July 2 -- The makeshift barricades thrown up in the streets of Leningrad when the Germans stormed its gates in the Summer of 1941 have been demolished and today the city bristles with modern fortifications that promise another bloody defeat for Adolf Hitler's armies if they try again.
